item.description:
å‡ ä¸ªè¯´æ˜ï¼š

  1. propertiesé…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶ä¸­ï¼Œspring.messages.basenameå¿…é¡»è¦åŠ classpathå‰ç¼€ã€‚å¦‚ spring.messages.basename=classpath:i18n/messagesï¼›
  2. å¿…é¡»è¦æ‰‹åŠ¨é…ç½®MessageSourceï¼Œspringbootä¸ä¼šè‡ªåŠ¨é…ç½®ä¹‹ï¼›
  3. å¦‚æœä½¿ç”¨MessageSource.getMessage()æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå‚æ•°çš„å¼•ç”¨å½¢å¼ä¸º"code"ï¼Œè€Œä¸æ˜¯"{code}"æˆ–è€…"${code}"ã€‚å¦‚messageSource.getMessage("test.msg", null, Locale.getDefault())ï¼›
  4. åœ¨é…ç½®LocalValidatorFactoryBeanä¹‹åï¼Œæ‰å¯ä»¥åœ¨javax.validation.constraintsåŒ…ä¸‹çš„æ³¨è§£ï¼ˆ@Sizeï¼Œ@NotNull...ï¼‰ä¸‹çš„messageå±æ€§ä¸­ä½¿ç”¨"{code}"çš„å½¢å¼å£°æ˜æ ¡éªŒæç¤ºä¿¡æ¯ã€‚å¦‚ @NotNull(message = "{leftTime.not.null}")ï¼›
  5. springMVCçš„localeé…ç½®å’ŒJVMçš„localeé…ç½®ä¸ä¸€æ ·ï¼Œåœ¨application.propertiesä¸­é…ç½®çš„spring.mvc.locale=zh_CNå®é™…ä¸Šé…ç½®çš„æ˜¯WebMvcPropertiesï¼Œåœ¨è·å–æ¶ˆæ¯æ—¶ï¼Œlocaleä¿¡æ¯åº”è¯¥ä½¿ç”¨webMvcProperties.getLocale()1è·å–è€Œä¸æ˜¯ä½¿ç”¨Locale.getDefault()è·å–ã€‚

MessageSource is a powerful feature available in Spring applications. This helps application developers handle various complex scenarios with writing much extra code, such as environment-specific configuration, internationalization or configurable values.

One more scenario could be modifying the default validation messages to more user-friendly/custom messages.

In this tutorial, we'll see how to configure and manage custom validation MessageSource in the application using Spring Boot.

item.title: ä¸€ä¸ªç®€å•çš„sqlä¼˜åŒ–ç¤ºä¾‹

ä¾‹å¦‚ï¼Œæˆ‘åœ¨æ‰§è¡Œä»¥ä¸‹sqlè¯­å¥çš„æ—¶å€™

 1SELECT projectId FROM lywl_equip_package WHERE salesId in (
 2		SELECT
 3		t1.id
 4		FROM
 5			cmp_datapackage_user t1
 6		LEFT JOIN cmp_datapackage t2 ON t1.datapackage_id = t2.id
 7		WHERE
 8			t1.sales_cycle > 1
 9		AND t1.is_valid = 1
10		AND t1.is_share = 0
11		AND t1.sales_price <> 9999
12		AND t1.sales_name REGEXP 'ç§»åŠ¨.*/(å­£åº¦|åŠå¹´|å¹´)'
13		AND t2.operator =1
14		AND t2.is_share = 1
15		AND t2.datapackage_cycle = 1
16	)
